title: Iamkizito
author: Iamkizito
content: Good day to everyone on this Bitcoin platform.I've only come to know about Bitcoin now, and from the things I have heard about Bitcoin I was thinking of trying to invest but on a second thought a part of me seems I have come to know about this too late.I really do not mind purchasing a little fraction of it and holding for a long time but like I said I still feel like am here too late and that Bitcoin has reached a level where only those who are well to do enough can indulge in it's trade.Is my being aware of Bitcoin now too late or do I still have a chance?

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: It is not too late. Even gold that has been existing for centuries, it is not too late to know about investing in gold. Not to talk of bitcoin that is not yet up to 2 decades ago. Juts learn about bitcoin. Learn how to avoid those scammers and hackers. It is a speculative asset and make sure you do research about the price of bitcoin history.It is never too late because bitcoin is a store of value and a hedge against inflation. Its price will continue to increase after a long period of time.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: Every moment is an opportunity. When Bitcoin got to $30K+ I thought it was too late to invest so I didn't buy much then And if not for the forum I would have sold since thenNow Bitcoin is $100K+ and we just starting the bull run.Though it's not too late, you should be aware of it's volatility and correction. It doesn't always go up and could experience a fallBut be focused on the long term then you can really make something from it.

comments.author: Felicity_Tide
comments.body: Quote from: Iamkizito on January 07, 2025, 10:04:44 AMI really do not mind purchasing a little fraction of it and holding for a long time but like I said I still feel like am here too late and that Bitcoin has reached a level where only those who are well to do enough can indulge in it's trade.Who says you're too late?.but here is the catchy thing now, If you only plan on purchasing a little fraction and holding for long, you might still not be able to hit a good profit, compare to when you buy a decent amount(not too good, not too bad) based on your income.And from what you've just said, i don't think the problem is about you being too late(which you're not), but the problem is how you can accumulate. You might want to get yourself involve in something that gives you income(probably tech related or other businesses), so you can accumulate a good fraction. Let's be honest here, you need money to do things.Just don't care much about the 100K you're seeing now, instead, find ways to join the train.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: I totally understand how you feel. but I'm here to tell you that it's never too late to buy Bitcoin. While it's true that the price has appreciated significantly over the years, there's always an opportunities to buy.. Personally, I sometimes wish I had invested in Bitcoin earlier, but I'm still grateful that I got on board when I did. Watching my investment grow over time has been an incredible experience.If you have the funds to invest, I recommend using the dollar cost averaging method to reduce market volatility risks. This strategy involves investing a fixed amount of money at regular intervals, regardless of the market's performance.Don't let FOMO, fear of missing out or feelings of being 'late to the party' hold you back. Bitcoin's potential for long term growth remains promising, and every investor's journey begins at a unique time.

comments.author: betswift
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoThalion on January 07, 2025, 10:28:28 AMHey! Felt the same way, but I just started investing in Bitcoin last December. Honestly. I don't think it's too late. Even small amounts add up over time. Btc still has room to grow, better to start now and hold it. I invest on crypto mining (I'm mining BTC) and I do hosting. Good luck bro! It's never too late.And I am glad you understood it, bud.

comments.author: fikrett
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on January 07, 2025, 10:08:15 AMIt is not too late. Even gold that has been existing for centuries, it is not too late to know about investing in gold. Not to talk of bitcoin that is not yet up to 2 decades ago. Juts learn about bitcoin. Learn how to avoid those scammers and hackers. It is a speculative asset and make sure you do research about the price of bitcoin history.It is never too late because bitcoin is a store of value and a hedge against inflation. Its price will continue to increase after a long period of time.Also because its values will be upheld in the future to come. It will be as secure and decentralized as of now, if not more.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: it cannot be too late and it will never been too late. just because you have a big advantage while using bitcoin and not other crypto or fiat currency.however the value will change dramatically during the time. avoid these change in price, don't be impressed. Bitcoin will continue to rise, it mathematical

comments.author: john_egbert
comments.body: Quote from: bitbollo on January 07, 2025, 10:48:31 AMit cannot be too late and it will never been too late. just because you have a big advantage while using bitcoin and not other crypto or fiat currency.however the value will change dramatically during the time. avoid these change in price, don't be impressed. Bitcoin will continue to rise, it mathematical Volatility is both the curse and the blessing of Bitcoin.And I wouldn't say the value of Bitcoin is in its price - it's in the values it upholds and the way it is structured.

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: Quote from: Iamkizito on January 07, 2025, 10:04:44 AMGood day to everyone on this Bitcoin platform.I've only come to know about Bitcoin now, and from the things I have heard about Bitcoin I was thinking of trying to invest but on a second thought a part of me seems I have come to know about this too late.I really do not mind purchasing a little fraction of it and holding for a long time but like I said I still feel like am here too late and that Bitcoin has reached a level where only those who are well to do enough can indulge in it's trade.Is my being aware of Bitcoin now too late or do I still have a chance?It's hard to say that you are late. For sure, the biggest opportunity was before 2020 but I'd say that it's not late even today because I think that Bitcoin is a revolution in financial system. We had barter, then coins, then paper money, then fiat and now cryptos, this is truly one of the biggest financial revolution during our existence. So, Bitcoin is only 16 years old and humans have been existing for such a long time. So, no, it's not late to invest in Bitcoin. I also think that if governments really save their strategic reserves in Bitcoin, that means that it's not late, it's only beginning.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: There is no time that's considered to be too late; obey that part of you that said you should buy a little fraction of bitcoin. That's good advice: buy what you can afford for the main time and store it for the future. If you don't buy now, you will still consider today as being an opportunity that you could have used to join when the price is still low.Then you can sacrifice a little of your time to learn a bit about what you are investing in, know what it is, how to store it, and how to make use of it; it doesn't cost much to get the basic knowledge, only your willingness to learn.

comments.author: Promocodeudo
comments.body: Quote from: Iamkizito on January 07, 2025, 10:04:44 AMGood day to everyone on this Bitcoin platform.I've only come to know about Bitcoin now, and from the things I have heard about Bitcoin I was thinking of trying to invest but on a second thought a part of me seems I have come to know about this too late.I really do not mind purchasing a little fraction of it and holding for a long time but like I said I still feel like am here too late and that Bitcoin has reached a level where only those who are well to do enough can indulge in it's trade.Is my being aware of Bitcoin now too late or do I still have a chance?Buddy first and foremost you're welcome to Bitcointalk forum, am very happy that atleast you've developed interest of investing in Bitcoin and I believe you've an idea of how the investment works, the aspect of you coming late, i dont think you're late unless you got the information before this time and ignored it but even as that i believe once one is financially and mentally ready with the basic knowledge of investing in the said asset then such person is good to go, mate you're not late at all, you've a chance, there is no harm in trying with any amount you want to start with but consistency is the key to achieving whatever goal you want to set now as you begin this journey, though the price of Bitcoin is high which may still go higher as the clock keeps ticking so would you rather sit and watch as it keep up resurging without buying those fractions you have in mind, I think for me the answer should be no, buddy dont procrastinate if you're actually ready for this because time waits for nobody though it's your decision but as for coming late, I don't think you are but if you don't do this now then you will feel that you're late later so be wise in whatever decision you want to make now so that it won't affect you in the future.

comments.author: Alone055
comments.body: Quote from: Iamkizito on January 07, 2025, 10:04:44 AMBitcoin has reached a level where only those who are well to do enough can indulge in it's trade.That's not true, and you probably don't know how it works. Just because Bitcoin is priced at $101k (by the time of writing this post), it doesn't mean you need to have $101k to be able to trade it or buy it. Bitcoin has eight decimal points, which means that you can even buy a small portion of it. This is the beauty of Bitcoin: you can start investing in Bitcoin for as low as $10 or maybe even less if a platform allows it.Since you are new in this space, you should know that the market usually moves in a cyclical pattern. There are bull runs and bear runs. During bear runs, the market goes down, which is generally the best time for buying, and in contrast, the market goes up during bull runs, and that is when people sell the cryptocurrencies they have bought during the bear run.Buying low and selling high is the basic principal and strategy, but you should try and get as much knowledge as possible before you make your first investment.

comments.author: betswift
comments.body: Quote from: Nwada001 on January 07, 2025, 10:59:32 AMThere is no time that's considered to be too late; obey that part of you that said you should buy a little fraction of bitcoin. That's good advice: buy what you can afford for the main time and store it for the future. If you don't buy now, you will still consider today as being an opportunity that you could have used to join when the price is still low.Then you can sacrifice a little of your time to learn a bit about what you are investing in, know what it is, how to store it, and how to make use of it; it doesn't cost much to get the basic knowledge, only your willingness to learn.In the future, people would pray to get even a portion of sats for the price they would see in the decade to come, so I totally agree - we need to make the most of what we have currently now.

comments.author: JamesDaniel90
comments.body: It is not too late but with Bitcoin pretty much being at its all time high at $101k and expected to go higher through most of 2025, I would not go too  heavy into it this year.Wait until 2026/2027 to really invest as that will be the next bear market, price could be back down to $50-60k then.

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: Iamkizito on January 07, 2025, 10:04:44 AMGood day to everyone on this Bitcoin platform.I've only come to know about Bitcoin now, and from the things I have heard about Bitcoin I was thinking of trying to invest but on a second thought a part of me seems I have come to know about this too late. I am not going to lie to you. You are late. Or at least in comparison with others who were able to purchase bitcoin at a price lower than $1000 USD. Every passing hour, bitcoin may be rising more and more and for every passing hour that you have not invested in bitcoin the more you are being "late" to bitcoin. QuoteIs my being aware of Bitcoin now too late or do I still have a chance?Yes you are late but hope is not all gone. If you think you are going to be making the same profit as those who had bought bitcoin at less than $1000 USD with the same amount of money then your expectations will be ruined soon. However, you can definitely still make profit with bitcoin. It is quite unfortunate that you found bitcoin when it is already at $100k but you still have a lot of options. You can wait for the bearish season or you can wait for a dip even so miniscule just so you can take profit at the end of this year. It depends on what your preferences are and goals with bitcoin.

comments.author: Minor Miner
comments.body: Quote from: Iamkizito on January 07, 2025, 10:04:44 AMIs my being aware of Bitcoin now too late or do I still have a chance?If you are thinking of investing in bitcoin and it can give you thousands of percent returns or make you rich from small capital. I can say those days are over and it's too late to do that. But if your goal is just to make significant profits then as everyone said above, it is never too late to invest in bitcoin. We are no longer in the early stages of the bitcoin revolution but it is not too late to start now because for an asset that is only 15 years old, and compared to assets that are thousands of years old like gold or silver, it is still too early. Or compared to the traditional financial market, it can be said that there are still many opportunities for us to take advantage of and opportunities will always exist as long as the market exists.

comments.author: Finestream
comments.body: Know that our goal for bitcoin is to reach $500k or even $1m in the future, so currently it’s still on its $100k price, that only mean that you still have all the chances to buy and hold. And so the rest of the newbies here who have desires also to buy and hold bitcoin. If you have extra funds, go with DCA. At least, even with it’s high price, you are now starting to accumulate bitcoin slowly but regularly. Soon you will also benefit from the massive profits of bitcoin, just know your investment well and apply risk management. Where there is risk, there is also rewards waiting ahead.

comments.author: 0t3p0t
comments.body: Quote from: Iamkizito on January 07, 2025, 10:04:44 AMGood day to everyone on this Bitcoin platform.I've only come to know about Bitcoin now, and from the things I have heard about Bitcoin I was thinking of trying to invest but on a second thought a part of me seems I have come to know about this too late.I really do not mind purchasing a little fraction of it and holding for a long time but like I said I still feel like am here too late and that Bitcoin has reached a level where only those who are well to do enough can indulge in it's trade.Is my being aware of Bitcoin now too late or do I still have a chance?Not that late though just kidding 😅the only thing is that price right now is way too high compared to the past years but still there is no such thing as late in investment especially to a highly volatile Bitcoin. You can invest right now or just wait for a pullback and then jump-in. That is how it will be depending on your preferred strategy. If you are a buy and hodl guy then hell yeah buy now or you will miss the ride.

comments.author: arwin100
comments.body: Quote from: Iamkizito on January 07, 2025, 10:04:44 AMGood day to everyone on this Bitcoin platform.I've only come to know about Bitcoin now, and from the things I have heard about Bitcoin I was thinking of trying to invest but on a second thought a part of me seems I have come to know about this too late.I really do not mind purchasing a little fraction of it and holding for a long time but like I said I still feel like am here too late and that Bitcoin has reached a level where only those who are well to do enough can indulge in it's trade.Is my being aware of Bitcoin now too late or do I still have a chance?You just feel it that you are late its because you see that Bitcoin price is currently expensive for you to enter. But if you just do a research towards future development that might happen then provably you will get an idea about possible good growth with this coin and other opportunities that you can take advantage then you won't say anything that you are late about buying Bitcoin at this point. Also its good that you acknowledge that you can buy a little fraction of Bitcoins and this is already a good indication that you can start your journey by doing that.Also there's a lot of good suggestion here and hopefully you can learn from those words given by people since actually we are not late when it comes starting up our Bitcoin investment since anyone could enter at what price they want to buy.
